#Text=CONTENTS
#Text=CHAPTER
#Text=THE FIRST - THE DREAM CHAPTER
#Text=THE SECOND - THE WEAR AND TEAR OF EPISCOPACY CHAPTER
#Text=THE THIRD - INSOMNIA CHAPTER THE FOURTH - THE SYMPATHY OF LADY SUNDERBUND CHAPTER THE FIFTH - THE FIRST VISION
#Text=CHAPTER THE SIXTH - EXEGETICAL CHAPTER THE SEVENTH - THE SECOND VISION CHAPTER THE EIGHTH - THE NEW WORLD
#Text=CHAPTER THE NINTH - THE THIRD VISION
#Text=“ Man 's true Environment is God ”
#Text=J. H. OLDHAM in “ The Christian Gospel ” ( Tract of the N. M. R. and H. )
#Text=THE SOUL OF A BISHOP
#Text=CHAPTER THE FIRST - THE DREAM
#Text=( 1 )
#Text=IT was a scene of bitter disputation .
#Text=A hawk-nosed young man with a pointing finger was prominent .
#Text=His face worked violently , his lips moved very rapidly , but what he said was inaudible .
#Text=Behind him the little rufous man with the big eyes twitched at his robe and offered suggestions .
#Text=And behind these two clustered a great multitude of heated , excited , swarthy faces ... .
#Text=The emperor sat on his golden throne in the midst of the gathering , commanding silence by gestures , speaking inaudibly to them in a tongue the majority did not use , and then prevailing .
#Text=They ceased their interruptions , and the old man , Arius , took up the debate .

#Text=For a time all those impassioned faces were intent upon him ; they listened as though they sought occasion , and suddenly as if by a preconcerted arrangement they were all thrusting their fingers into their ears and knitting their brows in assumed horror ; some were crying aloud and making as if to fly .
#Text=Some indeed tucked up their garments and fled .
#Text=They spread out into a pattern .
#Text=They were like the little monks who run from St. Jerome 's lion in the picture by Carpaccio .
#Text=Then one zealot rushed forward and smote the old man heavily upon the mouth ... .

#Text=The hall seemed to grow vaster and vaster , the disputing , infuriated figures multiplied to an innumerable assembly , they drove about like snowflakes in a gale , they whirled in argumentative couples , they spun in eddies of contradiction , they made extraordinary patterns , and then amidst the cloudy darkness of the unfathomable dome above them there appeared and increased a radiant triangle in which shone an eye .
#Text=The eye and the triangle filled the heavens , sent out flickering rays , glowed to a blinding incandescence , seemed to be speaking words of thunder that were nevertheless inaudible .
#Text=It was as if that thunder filled the heavens , it was as if it were nothing but the beating artery in the sleeper 's ear .
#Text=The attention strained to hear and comprehend , and on the very verge of comprehension snapped like a fiddle-string .
#Text=“ Nicoea ! ”
#Text=The word remained like a little ash after a flare .
#Text=The sleeper had awakened and lay very still , oppressed by a sense of intellectual effort that had survived the dream in which it had arisen .
#Text=Was it so that things had happened ?
#Text=The slumber-shadowed mind , moving obscurely , could not determine whether it was so or not .
#Text=Had they indeed behaved in this manner when the great mystery was established ?
#Text=Who said they stopped their ears with their fingers and fled , shouting with horror ?
#Text=Shouting ?
#Text=Was it Eusebius or Athanasius ?
#Text=Or Sozomen ... . Some letter or apology by Athanasius ?
#Text=... And surely it was impossible that the Trinity could have appeared visibly as a triangle and an eye .
#Text=Above such an assembly .
#Text=That was mere dreaming , of course .
#Text=Was it dreaming after Raphael ?
#Text=After Raphael ?
#Text=The drowsy mind wandered into a side issue .
#Text=Was the picture that had suggested this dream the one in the Vatican where all the Fathers of the Church are shown disputing together ?
#Text=But there surely God and the Son themselves were painted with a symbol -- some symbol -- also ?
#Text=But was that disputation about the Trinity at all ?
#Text=Was n't it rather about a chalice and a dove ?
#Text=Of course it was a chalice and a dove !
#Text=Then where did one see the triangle and the eye ?
#Text=And men disputing ?
#Text=Some such picture there was ... .
#Text=What a lot of disputing there had been !
#Text=What endless disputing !
#Text=Which had gone on .
#Text=Until last night .
#Text=When this very disagreeable young man with the hawk nose and the pointing finger had tackled one when one was sorely fagged , and disputed ; disputed .
#Text=Rebuked and disputed .
#Text=“ Answer me this , ” he had said ... . And still one 's poor brains disputed and would not rest ... .
#Text=About the Trinity ... .
#Text=The brain upon the pillow was now wearily awake .
#Text=It was at once hopelessly awake and active and hopelessly unprogressive .
#Text=It was like some floating stick that had got caught in an eddy in a river , going round and round and round .
#Text=And round .
#Text=Eternally -- eternally -- eternally begotten .
#Text=“
#Text=But what possible meaning do you attach then to such a phrase as eternally begotten ? ”
#Text=The brain upon the pillow stared hopelessly at this question , without an answer , without an escape .

#Text=The three repetitions spun round and round , became a swiftly revolving triangle , like some electric sign that had got beyond control , in the midst of which stared an unwinking and resentful eye .
#Text=( 2 )
#Text=Every one knows that expedient of the sleepless , the counting of sheep .

#Text=You lie quite still , you breathe regularly , you imagine sheep jumping over a gate , one after another , you count them quietly and slowly until you count yourself off through a fading string of phantom numbers to number Nod ... .
#Text=But sheep , alas !
#Text=suggest an episcopal crook .
